Revision: April.
Publication country: India🔽Jape...🔽... should then fill it with flowers and incense.

original: jape / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / puṣpepahāraiśca tatoṣṭalpā prapūrayet //🔽saṃsthāpya cāgneruparijvālaye / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / nane //
analyzed: jape puṣpa ipahāraiḥ ca prapūrayet  saṃsthāpya ca agneḥ upari jvālaye
translated: Having installed it, one should light a fire around it...
And the crying Mahābhūti should flee.

original: tat kṣaṇā vālakomukto deśatpā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ///🔽ca / la / naṃ / siddhilakṣmī devyarcanaṃ
analyzed: tat kṣaṇā vālakomuktaḥ  ca la naṃ siddhi lakṣmī devī arcanam
translated: At that moment, the country will be released from the curse...🔽The worship of Goddess Siddhilakṣmī
Then, the worship of Goddess Siddhilakṣmī.
Now, the installation of the water pot.

analyzed: kumbhasa ai kālagan bhaya āḍhada vyanatha ḍhāva tha ālape  palape
translated: The water pot should be filled with water mixed with the five fragrances.
The water pot should be filled with the six fragrances.
The water pot should be filled with the three fragrances.
The substances should be arranged.
The five offerings should be made.🔽The garland of flowers should be offered.
Now, the purification of the water pot.
The nyāsa.
The vessel of worship, along with purification, is made of kuśa grass.
The purification of the offering vessel with the syllables शुद्धिचिकुधढतय🔽The sprinkling
The mudras of the three corners and the triangle
The mantra

original: ai hrī śrī hsphrī hskau tolate //
analyzed: ai hrī śrī hsphrī hskau tolate
translated: Ai, Hri, Shri, Hsphri, Hskrau, Tolasate.
The arrangement of the offering vessel, the worship of the goddess of wealth, the worship of the goddess of speech, the worship of the goddess of learning
The Gayatri

analyzed: kuvjikāyāḥ vidmahe kula dvīpāya dhīmahe tat naḥ kuvji pracodaya
translated: We meditate on the crooked one, the goddess of wealth, may she inspire our intellect.
The Dharana
The mudra of the cow's womb should be shown.
Thus the purification of the vessel.
Now, the purification of the offering vessel with the four streams and the syllables.
Now, the worship of the three principles
The assignment🔽In some places, the invocation of the deity
The statement
Shri-khanda-sandalwood, etc.
Vireśvarī, etc.
In the invocation of the sacrificer, the statement🔽Sandalwood, etc. The self-invocation

original: candanaṃ tyādi // svānaviya // vākya // nānāpuṣpatyādi // adyādivākya //
translated: The statement Various flowers, etc. The statement Today, etc.
The auspicious procession of the sacrificer's birth place and the binding of the sacrificial post
On the fourteenth day, the great Parva, the worship of the virgin goddess Shri-Vatsheshvari

analyzed: upacāra deva arcana nimiti arthaṃ argha
translated: For the purpose of worshiping the five offerings along with the worship of the deity, the Arghya flower
Salutations.
Om, to the purifier of the impurities of the mind, the Gayatri of the Kula mother Bhairavi, the flower
Salutations.

original: p / jajamānanapujā bhalathiyakaṃtaya // stotra // pathe // śrīsamvartā //
translated: The worship of the patron, the praise, the hymn, the path, the venerable Samvarta,
Brahmani, the letter Ai, and so on.
For the patron, on the fourteenth day of the great Parva, the worship of the five offerings to the venerable Kubjika
I offer the water pot and flower vessel.
Again, to the preceptor, the water pot.

original: puna ācārya na adyādisuryārghaṃ puna ācamanaṃ // nyāsaḥ //
analyzed: punar ācārya na adya ādi surya argham punar ācamanam nyāsaḥ
translated: Again, the preceptor should not drink the sun's Arghya, and again, the Achamana, the Nyasa.

original: khphre sakalaśatru pramarthanī astrāya phaṭ // //🔽oṃ hrī aguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: khphre sakalaśatru pramarthanī astrāya phaṭ    om hrī aguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ
translated: Kshre, the destroyer of all enemies, to the weapon, Phat.🔽Om, Hrim, to the thumbs, salutations.
Om, Hu, Ha, to the index fingers, salutations.

original: oṃ phre madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ //🔽oṃ kṣro anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: om phre madhyamābhyām namaḥ  om   ro anāmikābhyām namaḥ
translated: Om, Phre, to the middle fingers, salutations.🔽Om, Kshre, to the ring fingers, salutations.
Om, Kro, to the little fingers, salutations.

analyzed: khpre sakala śatru pramathanī astrāya phaṭ
translated: Kshre, the destroyer of all enemies, to the weapon, Phat.

original: p / karaṅga nyāsaḥ //🔽oṃ hrī hṛdayāya namaḥ //
analyzed: p b karaṅga nyāsaḥ  om hrī hṛdayāya namaḥ
translated: The assignment of the limbs.🔽Om Hri, salutations to the heart.
Om Hu, Ho, to the head, svaha.
Om Phre, to Shiva, vashat.
Om Kshra, to the armor, hu.
Om Krau, salutations to the three eyes, vashat.

analyzed: khphre sakala śatru pramathanī astrāya phaṭ
translated: Kshre, to the weapon that crushes all enemies, phat.
Thus the assignment of the limbs.
Om Kshre, svaha.
Having performed the breath control.
Open the three doors.
Worship of Siddhi Lakshmi.
Water bath.
Bath with the five sweet things, bath with the four.
Shri, sandalwood, etc.

original: vīreśvarītyādi // dṛṣṭi // karṇapalāta // aṭuḍola // jajamakā // svātacchāye //
translated: Vireshvari, etc., vision, ear ornament, atoda, jajamka, one's own shadow.
Various flowers, etc., assignment.

original: ai hrī śrī hsphre hskau oṃ akhaṇḍamaṇḍalākāraṃ vyāptaṃjena carācaraṃ //
analyzed: ai hrī śrī hsphre hskau om akhaṇḍa maṇḍala ākāram carācaram
translated: Om, the undivided circular form pervades the moving and unmoving by the fire of knowledge.

original: tato devaṃ sitaṃjenatasai śrau guruve namaḥ //🔽p / ai padmāsanāya pādukāṃ //🔽ai kunyāsanāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: tatas devam śrau guruve namaḥ  p a ai padmāsanāya pādukām  ai kunyā āsanāya pādukām
translated: Then, to the white god, the guru, salutations.🔽Om, to the lotus seat, the sandals.🔽Om, to the seat of the virgin, the sandals.
Om, to the leaf seat, the sandals, one's own face.

original: ai kini vicce koṃkanāya hra astrāya phaṭ // rāhile //
analyzed: ai kini vicce koṃkanāya hra astrāya phaṭ   rāhile
translated: Ai ki ni vi cche kōnkana-ya hrah astraya phat. Rāhile.
Ai hū phat vajrapañjare svāhā.

original: ai caramakulekulamacare hrā hrī hrū phaṭ svāhā //
analyzed: ai carama kulekulama care hrā hrī hrū phaṭ svāhā
translated: Ai caramakule kulamacara hrah hrī hrah ū phat svāhā.

original: ai kini vicce koṃkanāya hraḥ astrāya phaṭ // karasodhana //
analyzed: ai kini vicce koṃkanāya hraḥ astrāya phaṭ karasodhana
translated: Ai ki ni vi cche kōnkana-ya hrah astraya phat. Kara sodhana.

original: ai namobhagavatihṛt kamalāyai hrā śrīaṃguṣṭhābhyāṃ pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai namaḥ bhagavati hṛt kamalāyai hrā śrī aṃguṣṭhābhyām pādukām
translated: Ai namo bhagavati hṛt kamalāyai hrah śrī aṅguṣṭhābhyāṃ pādūṃ.

original: ai hsphre kuvjikāyai kuladīpāyai hrā śrī tarjanyāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai hsphre kuvjikāyai kuladīpāyai hrā śrī tarjanyāyai pādukām
translated: Ai hsphṛ kuvjikāyai kuladīpāyai hrah śrī tarjanīyai pādūṃ.

original: ai hrā hrī hrū varvarāsakhe hū madhyamāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai hrā hrī hrū varvarā sakhe hū madhyamāyai pādukām
translated: Ai hrah hrī hrah ū varvarāsakhe hū madhyamāyai pādūṃ.

original: ai ghore aghore aghorāmukhī vahurūpāyai hrī śrī anāmikāyai pādukāṃ //🔽ai cchā cchī mahantārikāyai hrā śrī kaṇiṣṭāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai ghore aghore aghorāmukhī vahurūpāyai hrī śrī anāmikāyai pādukām  ai cchā cchī mahantārikāyai hrā śrī kaṇiṣṭāyai pādukām
translated: Ai ghore aghore aghorāmukhi vahu rūpāyai hrī śrī anāmikāyai pādūṃ.🔽Ai chā chī mahan tārīkayai hrah śrī kaṇiṣṭhāyai pādūṃ.

original: ai kini vicce koṃkanāyai hraḥ śrīkaratalāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai kini vicce koṃkanāyai hraḥ śrī kara talāyai pādukām
translated: Ai ki ni vi cche kōnkana-yai hrah śrī karatalayai pādūṃ.
P. Karāṅga nyāsa.

original: ai namobhagavatihṛta kamalāyai hrī śrī urddhavaktrāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai namaḥ bhagavati hṛta kamalāyai hrī śrī urddha vaktrāya pādukām
translated: Ai namo bhagavati hṛt kamalāyai hrī śrī ūrdhha vaktrāyai pādūṃ.

original: ai hsphre kuvjikāyai kuladvīpāyai śrīpūrvavaktāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai hsphre kuvjikāyai kuladvīpāyai śrī pūrva vaktāyai pādukām
translated: Ai hsphṛ kuvjikāyai kuladīpāyai śrī pūrvva vaktrāyai pādūṃ.

original: ai hrā hrī hū varvarasikhe hrū śrī dajjinavaktāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai hrā hrī hū varvarasikhe hrū śrī
translated: Ai hra hri hu varvara sikhe hru sri dhaj jinavaktayaipaduka.

original: ai ghore aghore aghorāmukhī vahurūpāyai śrīurddhavaktāyai pādukāṃ //🔽ai cchā cī mahantārikāyai śrīpaścchimavaktāyai pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai ghore aghore aghorā mukhī vahurūpāyai śrī ūrddha vaktāyai pādukām  ai cchā cī mahantārikāyai pādukām
translated: Ai ghore aghore aghoramukhi vahu-rupaye sri urddhavaktayaipaduka.🔽 Ai chha chi mahanta-ri-kayaipaduka.

original: ai kini virce koṅkanāyai śrīparāparavaktāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai kini koṅkanāyai śrī parāpara vaktāya pādukām
translated: Ai kini virce kongkanaipaduka.
Thus the placement of the speech.

original: ai namo bhagavatihṛtakamalāyai hrā hrī hṛdayāya namaḥ //
analyzed: ai namaḥ bhagavati hṛta kamalāyai hrā hrī hṛdayāya namaḥ
translated: Ai namaḥ bhagavati hṛta-kamalāyai hrā hrī hṛdayāya namaḥ.

original: ai hsphre kuvjikāyai kuladvīpāyai hrā śrī śirase svāhā //
analyzed: ai hsphre kuvjikāyai kuladvīpāyai hrā śrī śirase svāhā
translated: Ai hsphṛ kuvjikāyai kula-dvīpāyai hrā śrī śirase svāhā.

original: ai hrā hrī hrū varvaraśikhe hrū śikhāyai voṣaṭ //
analyzed: ai hrā hrī hrū varvaraśikhe hrū śikhāyai voṣaṭ
translated: Ai hrā hrī hrū varvara-śikhe hru śikhavāya voṣṭ.

original: ai ghore aghore aghorāmukhī vahurūpāyai śrīkavacāya hū //
analyzed: ai ghore aghore aghorā mukhī vahurūpāyai śrī kavacāya hū
translated: Ai ghore aghore agho-ramukhi vahu-rūpāyai śrī-kavacāya hū.

original: p / cchā cchī mahantārikāyai hrau śrīnetratrāyai vaṣaṭ //
analyzed: a cchā cchī mahantārikāyai hrau śrīnetratrāyai vaṣaṭ
translated: Chha chhī mahanta-ri-kāyai hrāu śrī-netra-trāyai vaṣaṭ.🔽 Ai kini virce kong-kanāyai hrah aṣṭrāyai phaṭ.

original: ai kiṇi virce koṅkanāyai hraḥ astrāyai phaṭ // aṅga nyāsaḥ //
analyzed: ai kiṇi virce koṅkanāyai hraḥ astrāyai phaṭ aṅga nyāsaḥ
translated: The placement of the limbs.
Then the worship of the water vessel.

analyzed: ai ānanda śakti bhairava ānanda vīra adhipataye śkṣml vryī
translated: Ai hskṣmrvryū Ānanda-śakti-bhairavānanda-vīrādhिपतये hskṣmrvrī🔽

analyzed: śrī jala pātrāya pādukā hrāḥ hṛdayāt ityādi
translated: To the auspicious water vessel, the sandals, HRAUM, the heart and so on.
Invocation and so on.
One should show the dhenumudrā. The Gāyatrī:

analyzed: ai kuvjikā vidmaheḥ kula dvipāya dhīmahe tat nokuvji pracodayāt
translated: We meditate on the knower of the Kubjikā Vidyā, may she inspire us with knowledge of the Kubjikā Vidyā.
Consecration of all substances beginning with the self.
Then, the worship of the arghapātra:
To the lord of the heroes, the bliss of the bliss of the power of bliss, the queen of the kingdom of the great knowledge,
HSKSHMLVRYŪ, the sandals of the arghapātra, ŚRĪ.
HRAUM, the heart and so on.
Thus, the worship of the arghapātra.

analyzed: kacchapa mudrā vadhāḥ ānanda śakti bhairava ānanda vīra adhipataye
translated: Then, with the kachāpamudrā, HSKSHMLVRYŪ, to the lord of the heroes, the bliss of the bliss of the power of bliss,
ŚKSHMLVRYŪ, to the self, for the destruction of sin, the flower, the sandals.
AI, the unguent sandalwood, the sandals.
HRĪ, the three principles, the unbroken rice.
The glorious heroic ash and vermillion.
HSMPHREM, the deluder of all people.

analyzed: hsau nānā chatra alaṃkāra puṣpam pādukām
translated: HSROM, the various umbrellas, ornaments, flowers, and sandals.
The sandals of the forgiveness offering.
The vessel is filled with the thumb and ring finger, the excellent one sprinkles.
KSHAM KSHAM to the garland of Kshatrapalas, accept the oblation, SVAHAA.
V V to the lord of the young, accept the garland, SVAHAA.
G G to the lord of the Gaṇas, accept the garland, SVAHAA.
Samaya Chāya, Nyāya Chāya.
Thus the purification of the elements and self-worship.
Then the bathing of the deity.

original: tato mālinīpathe // mohaniphaya // atha pañcavali paradānaṃ //
translated: Then on the path of Mālinī, the destruction of delusion, then the offering of the five garlands.

original: ai narāsanāya pādukāṃ //🔽ai kṣā kṣī kṣu kṣatrapālāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai narāsanāya pādukām  ai kṣā kṣī kṣu kṣatrapālāya pādukām
translated: AI to the seat of men, the sandals.🔽AI KSHĀ KSHĪ KSHŪ to Kshatrapāla, the sandals.
The garland, AI to the seat of the peacock, the sandals.
To the noble son of Kula, the lord of the young, the sandals, the garland.
AI to the seat of the plough, the sandals.

original: gā gī gu ge gau geḥ śrī kulagaṇeśvarāya pādukāṃ // vali //
analyzed: gā gī gu ge gau geḥ śrī kula gaṇa īśvarāya pādukām
translated: GĀ GĪ GŪ GĀ GAU GĒH to the lord of Kula Gaṇeśvara, the sandals, the garland.
AI to the seat of the lion, the sandals.

original: yā yī yau yoginībhyo pādukāṃ // vali //
translated: YĀ YĪ YAU to the Yoginīs, the sandals, the garland.
AI to the seat of the ghost, the sandals.
To the noble Siddhi Cāmuṇḍā, the sandals, the garland.

original: āvāhanādi // daṇḍa // tarjani // yoni // vindu // garjamudrāṃ darśayet // jāpa // śrī
analyzed: āvāhana ādi daṇḍa tarjani yoni vindu garja mudrām darśayet jāpa śrī
translated: Invocation and so on, staff, threatening, yoni, bindu, one should show the Garja mudrā, the recitation, the noble
HRIH SVĀHĀ.
Kṣlău svāhā.
Yā svāhā.🔽Gau svāhā.
Hṣkḥphre svāhā.
Sūtra.

analyzed: ai gauryā putra kumāram gagaṇa niha tanu kṣetrapam yoginicañcā muṇḍā
translated: I Gauri's son Kumāra, the field-protector with a body struck by the sky, the yoginī Cañcāmunda,
The fierce-formed one, the remover of obstacles Gaṇeśa, with two tusks.

original: puṣpādyā dūpadīpā mikhamadhuvalibhiḥ śradhayātya ca yāmi cakreṇaṃ
analyzed: puṣpa ādyāḥ dūpa dīpāḥ ca yāmi
translated: With faith, I offer worship with flowers and other things, incense, lamps, food, honey, and oblations, to the wheel,

analyzed: pūjitānām vinihati duritam bhukti mukti padā tu
translated: May the sins of those worshipped be destroyed, and may they attain the stages of enjoyment and liberation.
May the worship of the five worlds be complete.
Then the purification.
Eating the flesh of Tambura and others.
Now the invocation.
The venerable Saṃvartā.

analyzed: a annanta maṇḍala āla śrī ādi deva pādukām
translated: A, the endless maṇḍala, the lotus feet of the primordial deity, the oblation.
The lotus feet of the peacock's sinew.
The lotus feet of the venerable Kulaputra Vatuka-nātha, the oblation.
Ai, to the seat of Mūṣā, the lotus feet.

original: ai gā gī gu śrī kulagaṇeśvarāya pādukāṃ // vali //
analyzed: ai gā gī gu śrī kula gaṇa īśvarāya pādukām
translated: Ai, to the seat of Gā Gī Gu, the lotus feet of the venerable Kula-gaṇeśvara, the oblation.
The invocation and other things, the staff, the index finger,
One should show the elephant mudrā.
Thus ends the rite of the three deities.

analyzed: tatodeva pūjana  ai āḍhāra śakte pādukām  pārukām
translated: Then, the worship of the deity.🔽Ai - to the power of the foundation, I offer salutations.🔽Ananta - to the power of the navel, I offer salutations.
Ai - to the power of the bulb, I offer salutations.🔽Ai - to the power of the stalk, I offer salutations.
Ai - to the power of the leaf, I offer salutations.🔽Ai - to the power of the hair, I offer salutations.

original: p / ai kaṇḍikāsnāya pādukāṃ //🔽ai pañcapretāsnāya pādukāṃ //
translated: Ai - to the power of the bulb, I offer salutations.🔽Ai - to the power of the five pretas, I offer salutations.

original: ai sarvāsnāya pādukāṃ //🔽ai vṛṣā snāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai sarva asnāya pādukām  ai vṛṣā snāya pādukām
translated: Ai - to the power of all, I offer salutations.🔽Ai - to the power of the bull, I offer salutations.
Ai - to the power of the lion, I offer salutations.
Thus, the seat.

original: oṃ hrī śrī khphre śrīmahārudrapretāsnāya pādukāṃ // dhyānaṃ //
analyzed: om hrī śrī khphre śrī mahārudra preta asnāya pādukām dhyānam
translated: Om Hrim Shrim Kshhrem - to the glorious great Rudra preta power, I offer salutations. The meditation.

original: oṃ hrī śrī khavyāṃgādkuśapāsu śuravarakṛbhītrānapātraṃ śilaḥ kumbhāsi
analyzed: om hrī śrī śura vara kṛbhī trāna pātram śilaḥ
translated: Om Hrim Shrim - from the limbs of the Kshavya, the vessel of the best of the brave, the skull, the stone, the pot,

analyzed: jvalita udbhaṭaiḥ śivā rudra skandha gatā
translated: Shining with the blazing and fierce arms, on the shoulders of Shiva and Rudra,

analyzed: śara kṣa sinibhām sundarī paṃca tri akṣe virājitām bhagavati
translated: Resembling a deer, the beautiful one with five faces, adorned with three eyes, I worship the illustrious
Shri Siddhi Lakshmi.
To the goddess Mahārudra Asani, I offer the meditation flower, salutations.

original: oṃ khphre śrīsiddhilakṣmī vidmahe nacatyāṃvikadhīmahī tannolakṣmī
analyzed: om khphre śrī siddhi lakṣmī vidmahe tat naḥ lakṣmī
translated: Om Kshhrem - to the glorious Siddhi Lakshmi, we know. To the goddess of wisdom, we meditate. To her, we offer salutations. Lakshmi
should urge.

analyzed: namaḥ bhagavatī siddhi lakṣmī īśvarā phaṭ svāhā
translated: Khphre, salutations to the illustrious goddess Siddhi Lakshmi, Svha.
One should offer a handful of flowers with the garland mantra.

analyzed: ai khphre namaḥ sarva siddhi yoginībhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Ai Khphre, salutations to all the accomplished yoginis, salutations.

analyzed: savva siddhi mātṛbhyaḥ namaḥ nitya uditā nandana nanditāyai sakala kula māyikāyai
translated: Salutations to the mothers of all accomplishments, always shining, delighted in the Nandana garden, the magical power of all the Kula,
